bugs.title: virt-manager can not find qemu-dm after upgrading to fedora 22

bugzilla.short_desc: virt-manager can not find qemu-dm after upgrading to fedora 22

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Unable to start domains because the qemu-dm emulator was not found

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
xen-runtime-4.5.1-2.fc22.x86_64

How reproducible:


Steps to Reproduce:
1.
2.
3.

Actual results:


Expected results:


Additional info:
virsh --connect xen:/// capabilities | grep lib64
      <emulator>/usr/lib64/xen/bin/qemu-dm</emulator>
the actual path is
      /usr/lib/xen/bin/qemu-dm

I did a symlink from /usr/lib674/xen to /usr/lib/xen so the file could be found.  I suppose the correct fix would be to adjust the capabilities.

This happened after upgrading from fedora-20 to fedora-22 using fedup.
I also see this problem. virt-manager cannot complete installation of fullvirt domains because /usr/lib64/xen/bin/qemu-dm cannot be found.

Spice clipboard sharing broken.

Spice QXL resolution autoconfig broken.

Resolved with: dnf downgrade "qemu*"

Same QXL resolution problem as "arcfi" - guest agent (vdagent.exe) 25% utilization!
USB redirection is disabled! 
qemu-kvm-2.3.1-6 is OK.

karma: -1

Windows 7 guest is extremely slow with version 2:2.3.1-7.fc22. Slow to the point of failing to boot because needed services do not start in time. The same guest works well with versions 2:2.3.0-3.fc22,  2:2.3.1-6.fc22 and 2:2.4.0.1-2.fc24.

CoreOS guests work fine. Please let me know if/how I can help. Thank you.
Confirming arcfi's discovery; this update in the host breaks spice-vdagent in the guest. Please revert ASAP....

Seeing problems with Windows 7 guest on F22 laptop. 
Worked around by running `dnf downgrade qemu-system-x86 qemu-kvm qemu-common qemu-img qemu-guest-agent` for now. Happy to help with troubleshooting just let me know what is needed.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-7295 Qemu: net: virtio-net possible remote DoS

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-7295 Qemu: net: virtio-net possible remote DoS

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the Virtual Network Device(virtio-net) support is
vulnerable to a DoS issue. It could occur while receiving large packets over
the tuntap/ macvtap interfaces and when guest's virtio-net driver did not
support big/mergeable receive buffers.

An attacker on the local network could use this flaw to disable guest's
networking by sending a large number of jumbo frames to the guest, exhausting
all receive buffers and thus leading to a DoS situation.

Upstream fixes:
---------------
  -> git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=ce317461573bac12b10d67699b4ddf1f97cf066c
  -> git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=29b9f5efd78ae0f9cc02dd169b6e80d2c404bade
  -> git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=0cf33fb6b49a19de32859e2cdc6021334f448fb3

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/09/18/9

Statement: 

This issue affects the versions of kvm package as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This has been rated as having Moderate security impact and is not currently
planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer
to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle:
https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1264392]

Created qemu tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1264393]

Acknowledgements:

This issue was discovered by Jason Wang of Red Hat Inc.

xen-4.5.1-13.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: xen qemu binaries no longer live in %_libdir, breaks libvirt Xen VMs

bugzilla.short_desc: xen qemu binaries no longer live in %_libdir, breaks libvirt Xen VMs

long_desc.thetext:
At least on Fedora, xen's qemu binaries now always live in /usr/lib/xen/bin (even on x86_64). Per the package changelog this was changed in 4.5.0-1, in January.

Existing Xen VMs on x86_64 Fedora are now broken (because they look in /usr/lib64) and you can't create a new one (because it looks in /usr/lib64).

This is affecting at least F22 and F23.

Patch should be something like:

diff --git a/src/xen/xen_hypervisor.c b/src/xen/xen_hypervisor.c
index 431c47a..e7fff85 100644
--- a/src/xen/xen_hypervisor.c
+++ b/src/xen/xen_hypervisor.c
@@ -2144,9 +2144,7 @@ xenHypervisorBuildCapabilities(virConnectPtr conn, virArch hostarch,
         if ((guest = virCapabilitiesAddGuest(caps,
                                              guest_archs[i].hvm ? VIR_DOMAIN_OSTYPE_HVM : VIR_DOMAIN_OSTYPE_XEN,
                                              guest_archs[i].arch,
-                                             (hostarch == VIR_ARCH_X86_64 ?
-                                              "/usr/lib64/xen/bin/qemu-dm" :
-                                              "/usr/lib/xen/bin/qemu-dm"),
+                                             "/usr/lib/xen/bin/qemu-dm",
                                              (guest_archs[i].hvm ?
                                               "/usr/lib/xen/boot/hvmloader" :
                                               NULL),

if we don't get Xen to move the binaries back.
Yeah I think the xen package needs to add symlinks at least, since otherwise there's no way to fix pre-existing VMs which have the lib64 path in their XML.
